name: Mercury
terrain: Mercury has a huge number of impact craters on it, which gradually formed on the surface over billions of years. Plains between craters. It is believed that these smooth surface areas were created by the movement of lava flows around the planet in the past. Mercury also has rocks scattered throughout the surface and reaching from tens to several thousand kilometers in length and from one hundred meters to two kilometers in height.

name: Venus
terrain: Venus - the surface, consists mainly of plains, the cause of the formation of which are powerful flows of lava, as well as two mountain regions, called Ishtar Terra and Aphrodite, many flat volcanoes have been discovered on Venus. It turned out that of the 1,000 impact craters that Magellan discovered, none were more than two kilometers in diameter.

name: Earth
terrain: Earth - when comparing the Earth with other solids in the solar system, its surface is impressively different, since there are no craters on it. Scientists also identify two geological mechanisms that, in their opinion, helped shape the Earth's surface. The first such mechanism is volcanic activity, and the second is mountain building.

name: Mars
terrain: Mars - the northern hemisphere has a fairly smooth topography and only a few craters, while the southern hemisphere is literally dotted with hills and craters of various sizes. The most significant discovery on the Martian surface to date has been channel detection. A feature of these channels is that, according to NASA experts, they were created by running water.

name: Jupiter
terrain: Jupiter - The planet's surface is completely covered with volcanoes. Storms constantly rage over the surface, which constantly change their shape. Lightning on Jupiter can be a thousand times more powerful than lightning on Earth, there is practically no good weather on the planet.

name: Saturn
terrain: Saturn - images of the planet and some of its satellites were obtained, but their resolution was insufficient to make out the details of the surface.

name: Uranus
terrain: Uranus - Uranus has latitudinal bands like other gas giants. It is believed that the reason for the appearance of a uniform atmosphere is the composition of its uppermost layer.

name: Neptune
terrain: Neptune - The upper layers of Neptune's atmosphere are 80% hydrogen, 19% helium and small amounts of methane. A remarkable weather phenomenon of the planet is rapidly moving white storms, which have received the name "Scooter". Observations have shown that this is a kind of storm system. Like the atmospheres of other gas giants, Neptune's atmosphere is divided.
